moves.5. Nc3 a6 6. f4: Karpov attempts to seize space on the King-side.
moves.6... e6 7. Be2 Qc7 8. O-O Nc6: Cobo is behind in development. He needs to activate his Bishops and castle.
moves.9. Kh1 Bd7 10. a4: Now Karpov attempts to bottle up Cobo's Queen-side as well.
moves.10... Be7 11. Nb3 O-O: Cobo has completed his development, but his position is quite cramped.
moves.12. Be3: Karpov's analysis indicates that Black's best move is now 12... P-QN3, stopping 13 P-R5.
moves.13... Bc6 14. Bb6: Karpov indicates that Black must here play 14... Q-Q2.
moves.15. Qd2 d5 16. e5: Karpov's refutation of 16... N-K5? would be 17 NxN PxN 18 P-B4!
moves.16... Nd7 17. Bd4 b5 18. Bg4: Karpov's King-side attack is taking shape.
moves.18... g6 19. Rae1 Rc8: Another blunder by Cobo, reducing the King-side defences still further.
moves.20... gxf5: 20 KPxP would fall to 21 P-K6, per Karpov.
moves.22... Ng6 23. Bxg6 hxg6 24. Re3: The open KR file becomes the road to victory for Karpov.
moves.24... Bf8 25. Qh4 Bg7 26. Rh3: The final blow. Cobo's position is now in tatters.
